sense.gloss: aizuchi, back-channeling, interjections indicating that one is paying attention
two smiths hammering at an object in turn
hopeless swimmer, person who can't swim, someone who sinks like a stone
to make use of aizuchi, to back-channel, to throw in interjections to show that one is paying attention
magic mallet, lucky mallet, nursery-tale mallet that delivers one's heart's desire at a wave
tsuchinoko, mythical snake-like creature with thick midsection
to crack down on (e.g. crime, corruption), to deal a crushing blow to, to bring down the hammer on

r_ele.r: よこづちでにわをはく

sense.gloss: to hurriedly prepare one's home for guests, to clean one's garden with a mallet
one should do more than what is literally being asked for, when told (to bring) the chisel, (also bring) the mallet

sdata.j: ↑道具↑↓どうぐ↓↑箱↑↓ばこ↓に↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓しか↑入↑↓はい↓っていない↑者↑↓もの↓にとっては、あらゆる↑問題↑↓もんだい↓が↑釘↑↓くぎ↓のように↑見↑↓み↓える。
sdata.e: To the man who only has a hammer in the toolkit, every problem looks like a nail.

sdata.j: ボブは↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓のごとく、↑全↑↓まった↓く↑泳↑↓およ↓げない。
sdata.e: Bob can no more swim than a hammer can.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑過↑↓あやま↓って↑親指↑↓おやゆび↓を↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓で↑打↑↓う↓ち↑付↑↓つ↓けた。
sdata.e: He accidentally hit his thumb with the hammer.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓はうっかり↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓で↑親指↑↓おやゆび↓を↑叩↑↓たた↓いてしまった。
sdata.e: He accidentally hit his thumb with the hammer.

sdata.j: かくかくしかじかで、と↑事情↑↓じじょう↓を↑説明↑↓せつめい↓したのだが、あんまり↑興味↑↓きょうみ↓なさそうな↑相槌↑↓あいづち↓しか↑返↑↓かえ↓ってこなかった。
sdata.e: I explained the situation, as this, that and such and such, but they just nodded along without showing much interest.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑彼↑↓かれ↓を↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓で↑殴↑↓なぐ↓った。
sdata.e: She hit him with a hammer.

sdata.j: ↑俺↑↓おれ↓、↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓なんだ。
↑俺↑↓おれ↓、↑金槌↑↓かなづち↓なんだ。
↑話↑↓はな↓し↑相手↑↓あいて↓との↑会話↑↓かいわ↓が↑詰↑↓つ↓まったり、または↑何↑↓なに↓を↑話↑↓はな↓していいのか↑分↑↓わ↓からない↑時↑↓とき↓には、↑相槌↑↓あいづち↓を↑打↑↓う↓つと↑効果↑↓こうか↓↑的↑↓てき↓です。
sdata.e: Throwing cues that you are listening into conversation can be effective when you are struggling for words or don't know what to say.
